intro: Acrosanthes decandra, commonly known as the slender candlewood, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, candle-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in elongated spikes. Acrosanthes decandra is typically found in open forests and heathlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it a notable species within its native range.
